intro: Koeleria ciliata var. rigidiuscula, commonly known as the stiff-haired koeleria, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, greenish to brownish flowers. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered with fine, hair-like structures, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This variety is often found in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes.
